tif

Class DirectoryIFD

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.DirectoryIFD
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Directory<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>, java.lang.Iterable<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>

    public class DirectoryIFD
extends java.lang.Object
implements Directory<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>
    Represents an Image File Directory (IFD) in a TIFF file, conforming to the TIFF 6.0 specification. An IFD serves as a container for image-related data and metadata, composed of a series of tag entries that store various attributes.

    Each IFD can represent an image or a metadata structure associated with an image. Although not all directories contain pixel data, every image is described by at least one IFD.

    This implementation focuses on basic access to EXIF and standard IFD metadata entries, providing convenient methods for retrieving values in common data formats.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD

                    java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Constructs a new directory instance to manage a collection of IFD entries embedded within the TIFF image file.
        Parameters:
        dirType - a directory type defined in the DirectoryIdentifier enumeration class
        order - the byte order, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

        public int getIntValue(Taggable tag)
        Returns the integer value associated with the specified tag.

        If the tag is missing or the entry is not numeric, this method throws an exception, since numeric values are considered required when requested in this form.

        Parameters:
        tag - the enumeration tag to retrieve
        Returns:
        the tag's value as an int
        Throws:
